ETIA.CausalLearning.algorithms.tetrad_algorithm package

Submodules

ETIA.CausalLearning.algorithms.tetrad_algorithm.TetradAlgorithm module

class TetradAlgorithm(algorithm, verbose=False)[source]

Bases: object

mute_java_output()[source]

Redirect Java’s System.out and System.err to null streams to suppress output.

configure_java_logging()[source]

Attempt to configure Java’s Log4j logging level for Tetrad. Note: This may not be effective if Tetrad prints directly to System.out/System.err.

init_algo(data_info)[source]
prepare_data(Data, parameters=None)[source]
time_knowledge(ds)[source]
output_to_array(tetrad_graph_, var_map)[source]

Covert tetrad graph to numpy array update : Feb 17 tetrad_graph : graph from tetrad (it can be static or time series graph) n_lags : the number of previous time lags in case of time series

Returns:

  • matrix (a numpy array of size N*N where N is the number of nodes in tetrad_graph) – matrix(i, j) = 2 and matrix(j, i) = 3: i–>j matrix(i, j) = 1 and matrix(j, i) = 1: io-oj should appear only in PAGs matrix(i, j) = 2 and matrix(j, i) = 2: i<->j should appear only in MAGs and PAGs matrix(i, j) = 3 and matrix(j, i) = 3: i—j should appear only in PDAGs matrix(i, j) = 2 and matrix(j, i) = 1: io->j

  • if n_lags is not None then the first indexes of matrix correspond to the nodes of the time lag=0, then to time lag=1 etc

check_parameters(parameters, data_info)[source]
run(data, parameters, prepare_data=True)[source]
